Comment: Gonna take an unpopular stance here and say this is the wrong tactic to tackle the wrong problem.   Bias on Wikipedia perpetrated by the community editors doesn't have anything to do with the organization's tax status, and it makes exactly zero sense to fight fire with... taxation?  Wikipedia has little cliques of editors that control certain articles, and the proper thing to do is break up those cliques by beating them at their own game.  None of which has to do with weaponizing the tax code.  Wikipedia is (generally) a bright spot in a cesspool of AI generated or branded/advertising/sales content that dominates the web. As a whole, it needs to be nurtured and protected, even if parts of it veer off course - which should be corrected tactically/surgically - not bludgeoned with a blunt instrument.
Author: Jaegermeiste
